ground_truth: Evan is terrified. Then Lenny suddenly moves back and begins working on the model again, his eyes a million miles away. Furthermore, the walls behind him vibrate, slightly worse than before. Evan, Kayleigh, Lenny, and Tommy, all thirteen, watch the mailbox across the street with intense anticipation. When Evan comes to in this memory, the lit cigarette absently drops from his mouth and nestles into the folds of his shirt. The mailbox. Suddenly a car appears from down the street and slowly pulls into the driveway. Mrs. Halpern, 24, an attractive young mother, gets out of the car and walks to the mailbox. Mrs. Halpern walks back to the car. Evan looks on in horror and suddenly clenches his teeth in pain and silently swipes the front of his shirt, sending the lit cigarette to the ground. He pulls up his shirt revealing a fresh burn mark on his stomach. Andrea shakes her head. Evan nods, but something gnaws beneath the surface. Evan hastily hunts through his journals, tearing up the room looking for a certain book. Thumper, lying on his bed, quietly watches Evan with growing concern. Thumper jumps off the bed and snatches the journal away. Thumper begins scanning the journal entry. He hands the journal back to Evan. Evan opens it and begins reading it silently. His hands begin to tremble and he slams the book shut in defeat. Evan pulls into a parking lot of a country diner. Evan is about to enter when he spots Kayleigh coming out of the kitchen with a tray full of food. Her boss stares back in aggravation. Kayleigh's face turns beet red as she bends down to clean up the order. As she brings the mess inside the kitchen, a customer pinches her ass. Evan closely studies her reaction to the offense. She flinches uncomfortably but then composes a smile for the customer. Evan backs out uncomfortably. Kayleigh struggles with the zipper of a shabby coat as she exits. Evan steps out of the shadows. She's startled at first, but eventually recognizes him. A smile flickers across her face and she allows herself to be hugged. Kayleigh nods and they walk down the street. She reaches into her pocket, pulls out a pack of smokes. Evan nods and scrutinizes her face with his next question. Kayleigh stops walking and crushes her cigarette. Kayleigh begins to tremble. Tears flow. Kayleigh runs, stops and turns back to Evan. She turns and runs away. Evan, tired and depressed, sits on the lawn nearby, fingering the new burn scar on his belly. Evan enters his dorm. He ignores Thumper, who sits on Evan's bed sucking furiously from a gurgling bong. Evan puts a towel under the door.

Abruptly an automobile materializes from down the road and gradually maneuvers into the driveway. Mrs. Halpern, 24, an attractive young mother, exits the vehicle and strolls to the postbox. Mrs. Halpern walks back to the automobile. Evan looks on in terror and suddenly grits his teeth in agony and silently brushes the front of his shirt, sending the lit cigarette to the ground. Evan hurriedly searches through his diaries, tearing up the room seeking a particular book. Thumper, lying on his bed, quietly observes Evan with growing unease. Evan is about to enter when he spots Kayleigh coming out of the kitchen with a tray laden with food. Her employer stares back in irritation. Kayleigh's face turns beet red as she bends down to clean up the order. As she brings the mess inside the kitchen, a patron pinches her rear. Evan closely examines her reaction to the affront. She flinches uncomfortably but then composes a smile for the patron. Evan withdraws uncomfortably. Kayleigh struggles with the zipper of a tattered coat as she departs. Evan steps out of the shadows. test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Evan is terrified. Then, Lenny suddenly moves back, and the model is worked on by him again, his eyes a million miles away. Furthermore, slight vibrations, worse than before, are caused by the walls behind him. Evan, Kayleigh, Lenny, and Tommy, all thirteen, watch the mailbox across the street with intense anticipation. When Evan comes to in this memory, the lit cigarette is absently dropped from his mouth, nestling into the folds of his shirt. The mailbox. Suddenly, a car appears from down the street, and into the driveway, it is slowly pulled. Mrs. Halpern, 24, an attractive young mother, gets out of the car and walks to the mailbox. The car is returned to by Mrs. Halpern after she walks back from the mailbox. Evan looks on in horror; his teeth are clenched in pain, and the front of his shirt is silently swiped by him, sending the lit cigarette to the ground. He pulls up his shirt, revealing a fresh burn mark on his stomach. Andrea shakes her head. A nod is given by Evan, but beneath the surface, something gnaws. Hastily, his journals are hunted through by Evan, and the room is torn up while looking for a certain book. Thumper, lying on the bed, watches Evan with growing concern. Thumper jumps off the bed and snatches the journal away. The journal entry is scanned by Thumper. He hands the journal back to Evan. Evan opens it and silently begins reading it. His hands begin to tremble, and in defeat, the book is slammed shut by him. A parking lot of a country diner is pulled into by Evan. He is about to enter when Kayleigh is spotted by him, coming out of the kitchen with a tray full of food. Her boss stares back in aggravation. Kayleigh's face is turned beet red as she bends down to clean up the order. As the mess is brought inside the kitchen by her, her ass is pinched by a customer. Her reaction to the offense is closely studied by Evan. She flinches uncomfortably but then composes a smile for the customer. Evan backs out uncomfortably. Kayleigh struggles with the zipper of a shabby coat as she exits. Out of the shadows steps Evan. She is startled at first but eventually recognizes him. Across her face, a smile flickers, and to be hugged is allowed by her. Kayleigh nods, and they walk down the street. Into her pocket, she reaches, pulling out a pack of smokes. Evan nods and scrutinizes her face with his next question. Kayleigh stops walking and crushes her cigarette. Kayleigh begins to tremble. Tears flow. Kayleigh runs, stops, and turns back to Evan. She turns and runs away. Tired and depressed, Evan sits on the lawn nearby, fingering the new burn scar on his belly. His dorm is entered by Evan. Thumper, who is sitting on Evan's bed sucking furiously from a gurgling bong, is ignored by him. A towel is put under the door by Evan.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Evan is petrified. Lenny abruptly moves back and resumes working on the model, lost in thought. The walls behind him vibrate slightly more than before. Evan, Kayleigh, Lenny, and Tommy, all thirteen, watch the mailbox with anticipation. Evan regains consciousness in this memory, dropping a lit cigarette onto his shirt. A car appears, and Mrs. Halpern, 24, an attractive young mother, exits to check the mailbox. She returns to her car; Evan watches in horror, clenching his teeth and swiping the cigarette away, revealing a fresh burn mark on his stomach. Andrea shakes her head. Evan nods but feels uneasy. He frantically searches his journals, disrupting his room. Thumper, concerned, observes and takes the journal away, scans it, and hands it back. Evan reads, his hands trembling, then slams it shut in defeat. At a country diner, Evan sees Kayleigh, carrying a tray of food, being watched by her annoyed boss. Embarrassed, Kayleigh bends to clean a mess, enduring a customer's inappropriate pinch. Evan observes her discomfort, yet she smiles at the customer. She exits, struggling with her coat; Evan emerges from the shadows. Initially startled, she recognizes him and smiles, allowing a hug. They walk together; she pulls out cigarettes. Evan scrutinizes her as she stops, crushes her cigarette, trembles, and cries before running away. Evan, exhausted and dejected, sits nearby, fingering his new burn scar. He returns to his dorm, ignoring Thumper, who smokes a bong. Evan places a towel under the door.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Evan is terrified. Lenny moves back, works on the model, and the walls vibrate worse. Evan, Kayleigh, Lenny, and Tommy watch the mailbox intensely. In memory, Evan drops a lit cigarette onto his shirt, burning himself. Mrs. Halpern, 24, retrieves mail, then Evan hastily searches for a journal while Thumper watches. Thumper hands him the journal back, and Evan reads trembling, then slams it shut. Evan parks at a diner, watches Kayleigh spill food, flinch at a customer's touch, and leave. Evan steps out; Kayleigh smiles, recognizes him, and they hug. Kayleigh trembles, cries, and runs. Evan sits, touching his burn scar, and enters his dorm, ignoring Thumper smoking.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Evan is absolutely overcome with sheer terror. In a sudden and unexpected motion, Lenny shifts backward and resumes his work on the model with his focus and eyes seemingly lost in a distant, far-off place. Meanwhile, the walls behind him begin to vibrate, a subtle but noticeably worsening tremor compared to before. Evan, along with his friends Kayleigh, Lenny, and Tommy, all at the tender age of thirteen, watch the mailbox across the street with an intense and palpable sense of anticipation. When Evan regains consciousness in this memory, the lit cigarette, forgotten, falls from his mouth and settles into the folds of his shirt in a careless manner. The focal point remains the mailbox. Suddenly, a car makes its appearance from further down the street, steadily pulling into the nearby driveway. The young and attractive Mrs. Halpern, aged 24, emerges from the vehicle and makes her way to the mailbox. She then returns to her car. Observing this, Evan gazes on in horror, suddenly grinding his teeth in palpable pain and swiftly brushes at his shirt, causing the lit cigarette to fall to the ground. He lifts his shirt to reveal a fresh burn mark on his stomach. Andrea shakes her head in response. Evan nods in return, but there is something deeply troubling him beneath the surface. With unrestrained urgency, Evan searches frantically through his collection of journals, tearing through the room in a desperate hunt for a specific book. Thumper, while lying on Evan's bed, quietly observes Evan with an increasing sense of concern. Thumper then jumps off the bed and snatches the journal away from him. Thumper begins to scan the journal entry carefully before handing it back to Evan. Evan opens the journal and begins to read it silently to himself. His hands start to tremble uncontrollably, and he slams the book shut in utter defeat. Evan then drives into the parking lot of a quaint country diner. Just as he is about to enter, he notices Kayleigh emerging from the kitchen, carrying a tray full of food. Her boss watches her with clear aggravation. Kayleigh's face flushes beet red as she bends down to clean up the spilled order. As she carries the mess back into the kitchen, a customer rudely pinches her backside. Evan closely observes her reaction to the unwelcome gesture. She flinches uncomfortably at first but then composes herself with a forced smile for the customer. Evan backs away, discomfort evident in his demeanor. Kayleigh then struggles with the zipper of a worn-out coat as she exits the establishment. Evan steps out of the shadows. She's initially startled but soon recognizes him, allowing a smile to flicker across her face as she accepts his embrace. Kayleigh nods, and the two begin to walk down the street together. She reaches into her pocket and pulls out a pack of cigarettes. Evan nods, scrutinizing her face as he prepares his next question. Kayleigh stops walking and crushes her cigarette beneath her shoe. Kayleigh begins to tremble visibly. Her tears start to flow freely. In a sudden motion, Kayleigh runs away, stops, turns back to Evan, then turns again and runs away once more. Evan, feeling exhausted and depressed, sits down on the lawn nearby, gently fingering the new burn scar on his belly. Eventually, Evan returns to his dorm. He deliberately ignores Thumper, who is sitting on Evan's bed, sucking furiously from a gurgling bong. Evan methodically places a towel under the door.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Evan is consumed with an overwhelming sense of sheer terror that grips him entirely. In a swift and unexpected movement, Lenny suddenly shifts backward, resuming his meticulous work on the model with his concentration seemingly lost in a distant, far-off place. Meanwhile, the walls situated behind him begin to vibrate, a subtle but noticeably worsening tremor when compared to before. Evan, along with his friends Kayleigh, Lenny, and Tommy—all at the tender, impressionable age of thirteen—watch the mailbox across the street with an intense and palpable sense of anticipation. When Evan comes back to consciousness in this vivid memory, the lit cigarette, forgotten in the moment, falls from his mouth, settling into the folds of his shirt in an almost careless manner. The focal point of their attention remains the mailbox. Suddenly, a car makes its appearance from further down the street, steadily pulling into the nearby driveway. The young and attractive Mrs. Halpern, aged 24, gracefully emerges from the vehicle and makes her way toward the mailbox, then promptly returns to her car. Observing all this, Evan gazes on in horror, suddenly grinding his teeth in noticeable pain, and swiftly brushes at his shirt, causing the lit cigarette to fall to the ground. He lifts his shirt to reveal a fresh burn mark on his stomach. Andrea shakes her head in a silent response. Evan nods in return, acknowledging her, but there is something deeply troubling him beneath the surface. With unrestrained urgency, Evan searches frantically through his chaotic collection of journals, tearing through the room in a desperate hunt for a specific book that holds significance. Thumper, while lying on Evan's bed, quietly observes Evan with an increasing sense of concern evident in his expression. Thumper then jumps off the bed and snatches the journal away from him. Thumper begins to scan the journal entry carefully before handing it back to Evan. Evan opens the journal and begins to read its contents silently to himself, his hands starting to tremble uncontrollably, and he slams the book shut in utter defeat and frustration. Evan then drives into the parking lot of a quaint country diner. Just as he is about to enter, he notices Kayleigh emerging from the kitchen, carrying a tray full of food. Her boss watches her with clear aggravation and impatience. Kayleigh's face flushes beet red as she bends down to clean up the spilled order. As she carries the mess back into the kitchen, a customer rudely pinches her backside. Evan closely observes her reaction to the unwelcome gesture. She flinches uncomfortably at first but then composes herself with a forced smile for the customer. Evan backs away, discomfort evident in his demeanor. Kayleigh then struggles with the zipper of a worn-out coat as she exits the establishment. Evan steps out of the shadows. She's initially startled but soon recognizes him, allowing a smile to flicker across her face as she accepts his embrace. Kayleigh nods, and the two begin to walk down the street together. She reaches into her pocket and pulls out a pack of cigarettes. Evan nods, scrutinizing her face with curiosity as he prepares his next question. Kayleigh stops walking and crushes her cigarette beneath her shoe in a deliberate motion. Kayleigh begins to tremble visibly, her tears starting to flow freely down her face. In a sudden motion, Kayleigh runs away, stops, turns back to Evan, then turns again and runs away once more. Evan, feeling exhausted and depressed, sits down on the lawn nearby, gently fingering the new burn scar on his belly. Eventually, Evan returns to his dorm. He deliberately ignores Thumper, who is sitting on Evan's bed, sucking furiously from a gurgling bong. Evan methodically places a towel under the door, ensuring silence and privacy.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Evan, gripped by terror, watches as Lenny suddenly shifts backward, diverting his attention to continue working on the model with a distant gaze as if lost in thought. Behind him, the walls tremble slightly more than before, adding to the tension. Meanwhile, Evan, Kayleigh, Lenny, and Tommy, all thirteen years old, fixate on the mailbox across the street with palpable anticipation. As Evan becomes aware of his surroundings within this memory, a lit cigarette inadvertently slips from his lips and settles into the folds of his shirt. His attention returns to the mailbox. Suddenly, a car emerges from down the street, gradually making its way into the driveway. Mrs. Halpern, a 24-year-old attractive young mother, steps out of the car, strides over to the mailbox, and retrieves its contents before returning to the vehicle. Watching in horror, Evan unconsciously clenches his teeth in pain and swiftly swipes the front of his shirt, causing the lit cigarette to tumble to the ground. He then lifts his shirt to reveal a fresh burn mark on his stomach. Andrea shakes her head in disapproval while Evan responds with a nod, though an unsettling feeling lingers beneath the surface. With urgency, Evan frantically searches through his journals, disheveling the room in pursuit of a specific book. Thumper, lounging on his bed, observes Evan's frenzied actions with mounting concern. Leaping from the bed, Thumper snatches the journal and begins to examine the entry. After scanning the contents, Thumper returns the journal to Evan. Evan opens it and reads silently, his hands trembling as he absorbs the information. In frustration, he slams the book shut in defeat. Later, Evan pulls into the parking lot of a country diner. Just as he is about to enter, he spies Kayleigh emerging from the kitchen, balancing a tray laden with food. Her boss casts a displeased glare in her direction. Kayleigh's face flushes a deep red with embarrassment as she bends down to clean up the fallen order. As she gathers the mess and heads back into the kitchen, a customer provocatively pinches her, prompting Evan to observe her reaction intently. She flinches at the inappropriate gesture but then masks her discomfort with a composed smile for the customer. Feeling uneasy, Evan retreats. Moments later, Kayleigh struggles with the zipper of a worn-out coat as she makes her way out. Evan steps out from the shadows, causing her to startle initially, but recognition soon dawns upon her, and a fleeting smile graces her features as she allows him to embrace her. Kayleigh nods in acknowledgment, and together they proceed down the street. She reaches into her pocket, retrieves a pack of cigarettes, and offers one to Evan, who nods while scrutinizing her expression with his next query. Pausing mid-walk, Kayleigh crushes her cigarette underfoot as she begins to tremble, her eyes welling up with tears. Overcome with emotion, she turns to run, halts briefly, glancing back at Evan before turning away and sprinting off. Exhausted and despondent, Evan settles onto the nearby lawn, absently tracing the outline of the new burn scar on his belly. Later, Evan enters his dorm, disregarding Thumper, who occupies Evan's bed, fervently inhaling from a gurgling bong. Evan methodically places a towel under the door, shutting out the world.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Evan, terrified, suddenly shifts his focus as Lenny, distracted, resumes working on the model amidst vibrations in the walls. The group of thirteen-year-olds, Evan, Kayleigh, Lenny, and Tommy, watch the mailbox with intense anticipation. As Evan comes to in his memory, a cigarette falls from his mouth, burning his shirt and leaving a mark on his stomach. Despite Andrea's disapproval, Evan nods, though he feels unsettled. Desperately searching through his journals, Evan creates chaos in his room until Thumper, watching with concern, retrieves the journal for him. Evan reads, trembling with frustration before slamming it shut.

Evan arrives at a country diner parking lot and spots Kayleigh struggling with an order, her boss visibly annoyed. As she cleans up, a customer harasses her, and Evan notes her uncomfortable but composed response. After she exits, Evan approaches, startling her until she recognizes him and accepts his hug. They walk together until Kayleigh, overwhelmed, stops, discards her cigarette, and breaks into tears before running off. Despondent, Evan sits nearby, touching his burn scar. Later, Evan returns to his dorm, ignoring Thumper on the bed with a bong, and places a towel under the door.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Evan is terrified as he stands in the dimly lit room remembered for its unsettling ambiance. Then Lenny suddenly moves back and begins working on the model airplane again, a project he took up after watching an inspiring documentary, his eyes a million miles away. Furthermore, the walls behind him vibrate, slightly worse than before, due to the ongoing construction in their neighborhood, notorious for its noise pollution. Evan, Kayleigh, Lenny, and Tommy, all thirteen, watch the mailbox across the street with intense anticipation, a mailbox often used by the residents to exchange secret messages. When Evan comes to in this memory, the lit cigarette absently drops from his mouth and nestles into the folds of his shirt, echoing the consequences of his recent foray into smoking, which he took up after succumbing to peer pressure. The mailbox is the focus of their plan. Suddenly a car, a rusty old sedan, appears from down the street and slowly pulls into the driveway. Mrs. Halpern, 24, an attractive young mother known for her vibrant social life, gets out of the car and walks to the mailbox. Mrs. Halpern walks back to the car, her expression unreadable after collecting the mail that might contain more than just bills. Evan looks on in horror and suddenly clenches his teeth in pain and silently swipes the front of his shirt, sending the lit cigarette to the ground, an action that mirrors his recent struggles with self-control. He pulls up his shirt, revealing a fresh burn mark on his stomach, an unfortunate souvenir of his carelessness. Andrea, who has been a steady friend through his ordeals, shakes her head. Evan nods, but something gnaws beneath the surface, a creeping worry about what they've just set into motion. Evan hastily hunts through his journals, tearing up the room looking for a certain book, his personal diary where he meticulously documents his turbulent thoughts. Thumper, lying on his bed, quietly watches Evan with growing concern, aware of Evan's tendency to spiral into these frantic searches. Thumper jumps off the bed and snatches the journal away, acting on their old pact to help each other in moments of crisis. Thumper begins scanning the journal entry that held the secrets of their recent adventures. He hands the journal back to Evan. Evan opens it and begins reading it silently, his hands beginning to tremble as the weight of their actions takes its toll. He slams the book shut in defeat, knowing that some things can't be undone. Evan pulls into a parking lot of a country diner, a spot frequented by locals known for its hearty breakfasts. Evan is about to enter when he spots Kayleigh coming out of the kitchen with a tray full of food, her part-time job that helps support her family. Her boss stares back in aggravation, a man known for being strict and unforgiving. Kayleigh's face turns beet red as she bends down to clean up the order, which had accidentally spilled. As she brings the mess inside the kitchen, a customer pinches her ass, a disrespectful act that she, unfortunately, faces too often. Evan closely studies her reaction to the offense. She flinches uncomfortably but then composes a smile for the customer, concealing her discomfort behind a practiced facade. Evan backs out uncomfortably, his heart heavy with empathy for her situation. Kayleigh struggles with the zipper of a shabby coat, a hand-me-down from her older brother, as she exits. Evan steps out of the shadows. She's startled at first, but eventually recognizes him, relief washing over her features. A smile flickers across her face and she allows herself to be hugged, finding comfort in an old friend's presence. Kayleigh nods and they walk down the street, the familiar route they used to take to the park near their school. She reaches into her pocket, pulls out a pack of smokes, a habit she picked up to manage stress. Evan nods and scrutinizes her face with his next question, carefully choosing his words. Kayleigh stops walking and crushes her cigarette, overwhelmed by emotions. Kayleigh begins to tremble, her façade cracking under the pressure. Tears flow, a release of pent-up emotions. Kayleigh runs, stops, and turns back to Evan, conflicted about leaving him behind. She turns and runs away, needing space to process everything. Evan, tired and depressed, sits on the lawn nearby, fingering the new burn scar on his belly, a reminder of the confusion and pain simmering inside him. Evan enters his dorm, the small room he shares with Thumper, furnished with mismatched furniture. He ignores Thumper, who sits on Evan's bed sucking furiously from a gurgling bong, his usual way of unwinding, despite Evan's silent disapproval. Evan puts a towel under the door, hoping to contain the residual smell and protect them both from unwanted attention.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Her boss stares back in aggravation. Kayleigh's face turns beet red as she bends down to clean up the order. As she brings the mess inside the kitchen a customer pinches her ass. Evan closely studies her reaction to the offense. She flinches uncomfortably but then composes a smile for the customer. Evan backs out uncomfortably. Kayleigh struggles with the zipper of a shabby coat as she exits. Evan steps out of the shadows. She is startled at first but eventually recognizes him. A smile flickers across her face and she allows herself to be hugged. Kayleigh nods and they walk down the street. She reaches into her pocket pulls out a pack of smokes. Evan nods and scrutinizes her face with his next question. Kayleigh stops walking and crushes her cigarette. Kayleigh begins to tremble. Tears flow. Kayleigh runs stops and turns back to Evan. She turns and runs away. Evan tired and depressed sits on the lawn nearby fingering the new burn scar on his belly. Evan enters his dorm. He ignores Thumper who sits on Evan's bed sucking furiously from a gurgling bong. Evan puts a towel under the door.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Evan is terrified. Then Lenny suddenly moves back and begins working on the model again his eyes a million miles away. Furthermore the walls behind him vibrate slightly worse than before. Evan Kayleigh Lenny and Tommy all thirteen watch the mailbox across the street with intense anticipation. When Evan comes to in this memory the lit cigarette absently drops from his mouth and nestles into the folds of his shirt. The mailbox. Suddenly a car appears from down the street and slowly pulls into the driveway. Mrs Halpern 24 an attractive young mother gets out of the car and walks to the mailbox. Mrs Halpern walks back to the car. Evan looks on in horror and suddenly clenches his teeth in pain and silently swipes the front of his shirt sending the lit cigarette to the ground. He pulls up his shirt revealing a fresh burn mark on his stomach. She reaches into her pocket pulls out a pack of smokes. Evan nods and scrutinizes her face with his next question. Kayleigh stops walking and crushes her cigarette. Kayleigh begins to tremble. Tears flow. Kayleigh runs stops and turns back to Evan. She turns and runs away. Evan tired and depressed sits on the lawn nearby fingering the new burn scar on his belly. Evan enters his dorm. He ignores Thumper who sits on Evan's bed sucking furiously from a gurgling bong. Evan puts a towel under the door.

When Evan comes to in this memory the lit cigarette absently drops from his mouth and nestles into the folds of his shirt. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: George is overjoyed. Then Max suddenly dances forward and starts painting on the sculpture again, his mind a thousand galaxies away. Meanwhile, the floors below him bounce, slightly better than before. George, Clara, Max, and Danny, all twenty, gaze at the lamppost beside the playground with mild indifference. When George awakens in this vision, the glowing lantern casually floats from his grasp and lands among the folds of his jacket. The lamppost. Suddenly a bicycle emerges from up the trail and swiftly races into the garage. Mr. Smith, 42, a handsome elderly uncle, leaps off the bicycle and sprints to the lamppost. Mr. Smith sprints back to the bicycle. George gazes on in delight and suddenly grins widely in amusement and quietly pats the side of his jacket, sending the glowing lantern to the pavement. He lifts up his jacket revealing a new tattoo on his shoulder. Barry shakes his head. George nods, but something tickles beneath the surface. George leisurely explores his notebooks, organizing the closet looking for a different magazine. Hopper, perched on his window, loudly watches George with diminishing interest. Hopper flies off the window and tosses the notebook away. Hopper starts analyzing the notebook sketch. He throws the notebook back to George. George flips it open and starts analyzing it loudly. His feet begin to shake and he slams the magazine open in triumph. George rushes into a plaza of a city cafe. George is about to exit when he notices Clara entering the library with a box full of toys. Her teacher watches in admiration. Clara's cheeks turn bright pink as she stands up to carry the shipment. As she drops the bundle outside the library, an animal licks her hand. George distantly ignores her reaction to the compliment. She jumps eagerly but then forms a frown for the animal. George runs out eagerly. Clara dances with the buckle of a fancy dress as she enters. George leaps out of the sunlight. She's bewildered at first, but eventually identifies him. A frown flickers across her face and she refuses herself to be hugged. Clara shakes her head and they sit by the river. She reaches into her purse, pulls out a ball of string. George shakes his head and examines her hands with his next comment. Clara starts jumping and unfreezes her ice cream. Clara begins to laugh. Smiles beam. Clara skips, pauses and turns back to George. She turns and skips away. George, energized and elated, bounces on the pavement nearby, admiring the new tattoo on his shoulder. George exits his house. He listens to Hopper, who bounces on George's window singing quietly from a silent song. George removes a book from the desk.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Evan, along with friends Kayleigh, Lenny, and Tommy, all thirteen, anxiously watch a mailbox. In a memory, a cigarette drops from Evan's mouth, burning his stomach. Mrs. Halpern, an attractive young mother, arrives, and Evan experiences pain. Troubled, he searches for a specific journal, disrupting his room. Thumper, observing, hands the journal to Evan, who reads it with trembling hands and slams it shut in defeat. At a diner, Evan sees Kayleigh, embarrassed by her boss's reaction and a customer's inappropriate behavior. Outside, Evan approaches Kayleigh, who is initially startled but then smiles. They walk together until Kayleigh becomes upset and runs away. Exhausted, Evan sits, touching the burn scar on his belly. Back in his dorm, he ignores Thumper, focused on numbing his mind.
